alert.note: Alert for Bent (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 03 at 5:30PM MDT until June 03 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BENT COUNTY... At 530 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes were located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Blue Lake to near John Martin Reservoir, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... John Martin Reservoir around 535 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these tornadic storms include Hasty and McClave. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
